intro: Anticlea mogollonensis, commonly known as the Mogollon's antclea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Anticlea mogollonensis is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
